meanings.definition: To free from an obligation or liability
meanings.sent1: The teacher exempts the student from the final exam.
meanings.sent2: The doctor exempts you from taking medicine if you feel better.
meanings.sent3: The kind fairy exempts the young princess from doing chores.
meanings.sent4: Love exempts us from the burdens of the world, if only for a moment.
meanings.sent5: The golden key exempts its holder from all harm.

meanings.definition: To excuse from a duty or requirement
meanings.sent1: The boss exempts employees from working overtime on weekends.
meanings.sent2: The judge exempts the witness from revealing confidential information.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf exempts himself from following the rules.
meanings.sent4: Laughter exempts us from the seriousness of life's demands.
meanings.sent5: A loyal friend exempts you from facing challenges alone.

meanings.definition: Not subject to a particular rule or regulation
meanings.sent1: The queen is exempt from paying taxes in her kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The rare flower is exempt from the usual watering schedule.
meanings.sent3: The magical creature is exempt from the laws of nature.
meanings.sent4: Her smile is exempt from any flaws, shining brightly.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact is exempt from decay, standing the test of time.
